intro: Synaphea damopsis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved synaphea, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a slightly serrated edge. Synaphea damopsis is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
